name: Frances H.
content:
I'm shaking typing this. Just got the email - I'M CERTIFIED üéì

Okay let me back up. 18 months ago, I was a burnt-out Pilates instructor teaching 6 classes a day for $35/hour. My body was breaking down. My 47-year-old joints screamed at me every morning.

I kept telling clients "you need to fix your nutrition and stress" but I had ZERO tools to actually help them do that. I felt like a fraud.

Then I saw an ad for this program while doom-scrolling at 11pm. I almost scrolled past but something stopped me.

The mini diploma changed EVERYTHING.

I learned WHY my clients weren't getting results. It wasn't about doing more Pilates - it was about gut health, hormones, inflammation. Things I never learned in any fitness certification.

Now? I've transitioned to health coaching. I charge $350/session instead of $35. I work with 12 women vs teaching to 30 strangers. I'm making $7.4K/month working HALF the hours.

And my body? Finally healing because I'm not destroying it anymore.

To anyone who's scared to make the jump - your future self is begging you to do it.

#FunctionalMedicinePractitioner #CareerChange #CertifiedAndProud

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: Frances!! I remember your first message to me - "I don't know if I can do this." Look at you now! Your clients are SO lucky to have someone who truly understands both movement AND the deeper health piece. This is what happens when you bet on yourself. üíõ

comments.name: Jennifer M.
comments.content: $350/session?! Girl that's incredible. I was too scared to charge over $150 at first. Raising my prices next month thanks to posts like this üí™

comments.name: Michelle R.
comments.content: The part about feeling like a fraud hit me so hard. I felt the exact same way as a personal trainer. Now I actually have TOOLS. Congrats on your certification!! üéâ

name: Gloria C.
content:
üì£ UPDATE: Just finished my 10th paying client session!

But let me tell you about client #1 because it almost broke me...

Her name is Diane. She messaged me 3 days after I got certified. I was TERRIFIED. Imposter syndrome was screaming "who are you to help anyone??"

I almost told her I wasn't ready.

But I thought about everything I learned. The protocols. The frameworks. The cases we studied. I took a deep breath and said yes.

First session: 90 minutes. I used the intake forms from Module 15. I listened to her story about 8 years of bloating, fatigue, and brain fog. Doctors told her she was "fine" - labs were "normal."

Spoiler: She wasn't fine. We found multiple root causes.

She cried during that first session. Not sad crying - RELIEVED crying. She said "no one has ever asked me these questions before."

I cried in my car after she left.

Diane is now 6 weeks in. Her bloating is 80% better. Her energy is back. Her husband says she's "a different person."

AND she's referred me 3 more clients.

The ripple effect is real. All because I said yes when I was scared.

#FirstClient #ImposterSyndromeWho #FunctionalMedicineWorks

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: Gloria, I'm literally tearing up reading this. "No one has ever asked me these questions before" - this is EXACTLY why we do this work. The gap in conventional healthcare is massive. YOU are filling it. Keep going, keep helping, keep changing lives. üôèüíõ

comments.name: Rachel T.
comments.content: The referral part is everything!! My first client has now referred FIVE people to me. Word of mouth is the best marketing. Congrats on 10 sessions!! üôå

name: Janet R.
content:
2025 INCOME REPORT üìä

Okay I'm doing this because I promised myself I would be transparent. And because I know some of you need to see real numbers.

My 2025 in functional medicine coaching:

September (certified): $1,200
October: $3,800
November: $6,400  
December: $9,700

TOTAL: $21,100 in 4 months

AND I still sold real estate part-time until November.

Now here's what's even crazier:

December I worked with 14 clients. Average package: $2,100 for 8 weeks. I worked maybe 25 hours that week. From my spare bedroom. In yoga pants.

My last year in full-time real estate? $87K. Working 60+ hours/week. Weekends. Holidays. Answering calls at 10pm.

I made a QUARTER of that in 4 MONTHS working PART-TIME in functional medicine.

Sarah's Business Accelerator module literally handed me the blueprint. The pricing strategies. The sales conversations. The client attraction system.

January goal: $12K month
2026 goal: Replace my entire real estate income (and then some)

To everyone just starting: the math works. Trust the process.

#IncomeReport #FunctionalMedicineIncome #TheNumbersDontLie

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: Janet! This is EXACTLY the kind of transparency our community needs. From realtor to almost $10K/mo in 4 months?! And you're just getting started. The difference between real estate and this work: you're changing LIVES, not just closing deals. So proud of you. Your $12K January is coming! üî•

name: Virginia P.
content:
I need to tell you about a moment I had yesterday.

I was in Whole Foods buying groceries. Nothing special. Just another Tuesday.

A woman stopped me. "Virginia? Is that you?"

It was a client from 6 months ago. She came to me with:
- Chronic pain for 12 years
- Fibromyalgia diagnosis
- 4 different medications
- Zero hope

I almost didn't recognize her. She looked 10 years younger. She was GLOWING.

"I'm off 3 of my medications," she told me. "I sleep through the night now. I can play with my grandkids without hurting. You gave me my life back."

She hugged me in aisle 7. We both cried next to the organic spinach.

You guys, I've been a physical therapist for 22 years. I've helped people walk again after surgeries. I've seen incredible recoveries.

But NOTHING compares to helping someone find root cause answers after a decade of suffering.

This certification didn't just change my career. It changed what kind of healer I am.

Thank you, Sarah. Thank you, this community. Thank you to everyone who pushed through the same fears I had.

We're actually changing lives out here.

#GratitudePost #RootCauseMedicine #ChangingLives

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: Virginia, I'm crying reading this. "You gave me my life back." This is why we do what we do. After 22 years in PT, you had the humility to learn something new and the courage to integrate it. That's not common. Your client is blessed to have found you. And WE are blessed to have you in this community. Thank you for sharing this beautiful moment. üíõüôè

comments.name: Maria T.
comments.content: "Cried next to the organic spinach" üò≠ This is everything. I'm keeping this post for when I have hard days.

comments.name: Ashley C.
comments.content: Off 3 medications?! The conventional system would have just added MORE meds. This is why functional medicine matters so much. Beautiful story üíï

comments.content: As a nurse who's seen patients suffer for years on med after med, this gives me so much hope. Starting Module 5 today with renewed motivation!

name: Ruth H.
content:
Real talk because I don't want anyone to think this was easy.

I failed the certification exam. Twice.

The first time, I was devastated. Cried for two days. Thought about quitting. My husband found me on the couch eating ice cream at 2am saying "I'm too dumb for this."

The second time, I was CRUSHED. I messaged Sarah ready to ask for a refund.

Her response changed everything.

She said: "Ruth, you're not failing. You're learning. The women who will trust you with their health - they need YOU to understand this deeply. Take a breath. Take a week. Then try again."

I rewatched every single module. Took new notes. Made flashcards like I was in nursing school again.

Third time? PASSED with 94%.

And you know what? Those "failures" made me a BETTER practitioner. I know this material backwards and forwards now. When clients ask me questions, I don't have to think - I just KNOW.

Last month: My first full month - $5,800. Working evenings and weekends around my dental hygiene job.

To anyone struggling right now: You're not behind. You're not dumb. You're building something solid.

Fail forward. Then succeed.

#RealTalk #FailForward #ThirdTimesTheCharm

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: Ruth!! I remember those messages. I remember your fear and your determination in the same breath. You didn't quit when most people would have. And now look at you - $5.8K your first full month, WHILE still working your day job. This is what resilience looks like. Thank you for being brave enough to share the messy middle. Someone reading this needed to hear it TODAY. üíõüí™

comments.name: Kimberly J.
comments.content: I'm literally taking the exam tomorrow and I'm terrified. This is exactly what I needed to read. Even if I don't pass, I'll try again. Thank you üôè

comments.name: Sarah M.
comments.content: @Kimberly - You've got this! Deep breaths. Trust what you've learned. And remember: this exam tests what you KNOW, not your worth as a person. Rooting for you! üôå

comments.name: Jessica F.
comments.content: "Fail forward" - writing that on my mirror. Failed first attempt last week but I'm already rewatching modules. If Ruth can do it, so can I! üí™

comments.content: Ice cream at 2am is so relatable üòÇ But seriously, the vulnerability in this post is beautiful. And $5.8K while still working?! That's incredible. Congrats!
